field has no meaning for configuration change traps.

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmHardwareFault.
Additional Info 1 carries HW Error Code (refer to HW Event Log for details).
Additional Info 2 is not used.
Additional Info 3 is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'APEX hardware fault resolved' : 'APEX hardware fault occurred'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmPowerFault.
Additional Info 1 carries the apexPsStatusTable index (1 to 2).
Additional Info 2 is not used.
Additional Info 3 is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'APEX power fault resolved' : 'APEX power fault occurred'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmGbeInputStreamHighBitRate.
This trap is sent on a summary basis.
Additional Info 1 is not used.
Additional Info 2 is not used.
Additional Info 3 is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'GbE input stream within expected bit rate' : 'GbE input stream in higher than expected bit rate'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmGbeLossOfInputStream.
This trap is sent on a summary basis.
Additional Info 1 is not used.
Additional Info 2 is not used.
Additional Info 3 is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'GbE input stream loss resolved' : 'Loss of GbE input stream'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.

the trap.

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmOutputOverflow.
This trap is sent on an Output Transport Stream basis.
Additional Info 1 carries the Output Transport Stream number (1 to 48).
Additional Info 2 is not used.
Additional Info 3 is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'APEX output transport stream overflow state resolved' : 'APEX output transport stream in overflow state'

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmQamRfPortFault.
This trap is sent on a QAM RF Port basis.
Additional Info 1 carries the QAM RF Port number:
RF Port 1 = QAM Module 1, RF 1
RF Port 2 = QAM Module 1, RF 2
RF Port 3 = QAM Module 2, RF 1
RF Port 4 = QAM Module 2, RF 2
RF Port 5 = QAM Module 3, RF 1
RF Port 6 = QAM Module 3, RF 2
Additional Info 2 is not used.
Additional Info 3 is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'QAM RF port fault resolved' : 'QAM RF port fault occurred'

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmQamChannelFault.
This trap is sent on a QAM Channel basis.
Additional Info 1 carries the QAM Channel number.
1 to 8 = QAM Module 1, RF 1, QAM Channel A to H
9 to 16 = QAM Module 1, RF 2, QAM Channel A to H
17 to 24 = QAM Module 2, RF 1, QAM Channel A to H
25 to 32 = QAM Module 2, RF 2, QAM Channel A to H
33 to 40 = QAM Module 3, RF 1, QAM Channel A to H
41 to 48 = QAM Module 3, RF 2, QAM Channel A to H
Additional Info 2 is not used.
Additional Info 3 is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'QAM channel fault resolved' : 'QAM channel fault occurred'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmQamRfRedundFailOver.
This trap is sent on a Primary QAM RF Port basis.
Additional Info 1 carries the Primary QAM RF Port number.
Additional Info 2 is not used.
Additional Info 3 is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'QAM RF redundancy system failover resolved' : 'QAM RF redundancy system failover occurred'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmRemCommFault.
This trap is sent on a summary basis.
Additional Info is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'Remote communication fault resolved' : 'Remote communication fault occurred'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmDtiSyncLossFault.
This trap is sent on a summary basis.
Additional Info is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'DTI synchronization loss resolved' : 'DTI synchronization loss occurred'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding alarm apexAlarmChassisRedundancyLinkFault.
This trap is sent on a summary basis.
Additional Info is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'Chassis redundancy link fault resolved' : 'Chassis redundancy link fault occurred'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger3

description: See corresponding event apexEventChassisRedunPrimaryForceFailover.
Additional Info is not used.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'Chassis redundancy primary force unit failover resolved' : 'Chassis redundancy primary force unit failover occurred'

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: This object identifies the specific notification issued by the
network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapSequenceId

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time, in hundreths of a second since the
network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger1

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: BCS-TRAPS-MIB::trapAdditionalInfoInteger2

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
